solution_line_template: Sam bought {num_boxes} boxes x ${cost_per_box} = $<<{num_boxes}*{cost_per_box}={total_cost_of_highlighters}>>{total_cost_of_highlighters} worth of highlighters.

Sam then took {num_rearranged_boxes} boxes * {highlighters_per_rearranged_box} highlighters/box = <<{num_rearranged_boxes}*{highlighters_per_rearranged_box}={highlighters_from_rearranged_boxes}>>{highlighters_from_rearranged_boxes} highlighters.

After selling these {num_rearranged_boxes} boxes there were {total_highlighters} - {highlighters_from_rearranged_boxes} = <<{total_highlighters}-{highlighters_from_rearranged_boxes}={remaining_highlighters}>>{remaining_highlighters} highlighters remaining.

These form {remaining_highlighters} / {pens_per_group_sold_separately} = <<{remaining_highlighters}/{pens_per_group_sold_separately}={num_groups_sold_separately}>>{num_groups_sold_separately} groups of three pens.

He sold each of these groups for ${price_per_group_sold_separately} each, so made {num_groups_sold_separately} * {price_per_group_sold_separately} = $<<{num_groups_sold_separately}*{price_per_group_sold_separately}={revenue_from_separate_sales}>>{revenue_from_separate_sales} from them.
Since his original cost was ${total_cost_of_highlighters}, he earned ${total_revenue} - ${total_cost_of_highlighters} = $<<{total_revenue}-{total_cost_of_highlighters}={profit}>>{profit} in profit.
